events.originalText: "Il Canto degli Italiani" officially became the national anthem of Italy, 66 years after it was provisionally chosen following the birth of the Italian Republic.
events.subtitle: Il Canto degli Italiani
events.headline: Italy adopts 'Il Canto degli Italiani' as national anthem after 66 years

events.originalText: Arab Spring: After months of protests in Yemen, President Ali Abdullah Saleh agreed to transfer power to Vice President Abdrabbuh Mansur Hadi.
events.subtitle: Arab Spring
events.headline: President Ali Abdullah Saleh agrees to transfer power in Yemen

events.originalText: A crowd of people on their way to register Esmael Mangudadatu's candidacy for governor of Maguindanao, Philippines, were kidnapped and killed by supporters of his rival, resulting in 58 deaths.
events.subtitle: Esmael Mangudadatu
events.headline: 58 killed in kidnapping of Esmael Mangudadatu's supporters in Philippines

events.originalText: MS Explorer became the first cruise ship to sink in the Southern Ocean.
events.subtitle: MV Explorer (1969)
events.headline: MS Explorer sinks in Southern Ocean, first cruise ship to do so

events.originalText: Rose Revolution: Eduard Shevardnadze resigned as President of Georgia following weeks of mass protests over disputed election results.
events.subtitle: Rose Revolution
events.headline: Eduard Shevardnadze resigns as President of Georgia after Rose Revolution

events.originalText: An earthquake struck the Irpinia region of Italy, killing at least 2,483 people, injuring more than 7,700 and leaving 250,000 homeless.
events.subtitle: 1980 Irpinia earthquake
events.headline: 2,483 dead in earthquake in Irpinia region of Italy

events.originalText: Jacques Mayol became the first person to freedive to a depth of 100 metres (330 ft).
events.subtitle: Jacques Mayol
events.headline: Jacques Mayol sets record for freediving to 100 meters

events.originalText: The first episode of Doctor Who, the world's longest-running science fiction television show, was broadcast on BBC television, starring William Hartnell as the first incarnation of the title role.
events.subtitle: An Unearthly Child
events.headline: First episode of Doctor Who airs on BBC television

events.originalText: The New York Times published evidence from Edwin Hubble (pictured) stating that the Andromeda Nebula, previously believed to be part of the Milky Way, is in fact another galaxy.
events.subtitle: The New York Times
events.headline: New York Times reveals Andromeda Nebula is another galaxy

events.originalText: William "Boss" Tweed, a New York City politician who had been arrested for embezzlement, was handed over to US authorities after having escaped from prison and fled to Spain.
events.subtitle: William M. Tweed
events.headline: William 'Boss' Tweed handed over to US authorities after escape to Spain

events.originalText: The Manchester Martyrs were hanged in Manchester, England, for involvement in a scheme to free two Irish nationalists from custody in which a police officer was killed.
events.subtitle: Manchester Martyrs
events.headline: Manchester Martyrs hanged in England for police officer's death

events.originalText: African slaves in the Danish West Indies began an insurrection in one of the earliest and longest slave revolts in the Americas.
events.subtitle: Danish West Indies
events.headline: African slaves in Danish West Indies start insurrection

events.originalText: A papal conclave, which had been deadlocked due to concerns over how a successor would respond to the impending death of Charles II of Spain, ended with the election of Clement XI.
events.subtitle: 1700 papal conclave
events.headline: Papal conclave elects Clement XI after deadlock

events.originalText: In opposition to licensing and censorship during the English Civil War, John Milton's Areopagitica (title page pictured) was published, arguing for the right to free expression.
events.subtitle: English Civil War
events.headline: John Milton's Areopagitica published in opposition to censorship

events.originalText: Dutch pacification campaign on Formosa: Soldiers from the Dutch East India Company razed the village of Mattou, now part of modern-day Tainan, Taiwan.
events.subtitle: Dutch pacification campaign on Formosa
events.headline: Dutch East India Company razes village in Formosa pacification campaign
